Last night, a larger than usual Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Ukraine. More than 100 drones took part, striking targets in several different parts of the country.
Targets were hit in the following areas:
Opishnia, Poltava Oblast (gas treatment facility).
Novhorod-Siverskyi, Chernihiv Oblast.
Berezivka, Odesa Oblast.
Zolotonosha, Cherkasy Oblast.
Fastiv, Kyiv Oblast.
Sumy City, Sumy Oblast.
Lozova, Kharkiv Oblast (railway infrastructure). 
Samiilivka, Kharkiv Oblast (railway infrastructure).
Vasylkivka, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. 
Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast (something in the Limansky District of the city).  
Media 1 & 2 show fires at the Oposhnya Gas Treatment Facility in Poltava Oblast following a series of Geran strikes (49.9215, 34.6756). Media 3 & 4 show fires burning in Novhorod-Siverskyi, Chernihiv Oblast.

Media 1 & 2 show fires at the Oposhnya Gas Treatment Facility in Poltava Oblast following a series of Geran strikes (49.9215, 34.6756). Media 3 & 4 show fires burning in Novhorod-Siverskyi, Chernihiv Oblast.
Explosion in Mykolaiv City. Iskander-M strike. A recon drone was operating over the city.

The Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Mykolaiv City targeted something at/near a gas station on the western edge of the city. The exact target is unknown, but fuel is now leaking from this gas station. 
Coordinates: 46.984584, 31.903812

A Ukrainian long-range UAV struck the "Ring" oil pipeline in Moscow during yesterday's attacks, which is used to transport gasoline, diesel, and aviation fuel. The GUR claims that all three lines of the pipeline were damaged.
EDIT: This was a sabotage operation.

The Iskander-M ballistic missile strike on Mykolaiv City targeted something at/near a gas station on the western edge of the city. The exact target is unknown, but fuel is now leaking from this gas station.   Coordinates: 46.984584, 31.903812

The Mykolaiv OVA confirms my information about the Iskander strike.
The missile was equipped with a cluster warhead. 1 civilian was killed and 15 others were wounded.

GUR chief Budanov was spotted in Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast earlier today, following reports of him personally ordering the failed special forces operation on northwestern Pokrovsk. 
Coordinates: 48.53583, 35.81944 (72 km from the frontline, 100 km from Pokrovsk).
Ukrainian helicopters are flying in the area of Pokrovsk right now. Russian channels are warning of possible future landings of special forces.
Iskander on Zaporizhzhia
Iskander on Zaporizhzhia
Disappeared. Probably S-300/400 air defence from Crimea. There are Ukrainian UAVs operating over Russian controlled Kherson Oblast right now.
Ukrainian helicopters are flying in the area of Pokrovsk right now. Russian channels are warning of possible future landings of special forces.
A Russian air defence missile was launched from the Avdiivka area towards Druzhkivka, Donetsk Oblast. Possibly related to the Ukrainian helicopter activity.
HIMARS launches to Donetsk City
HIMARS launches to Donetsk City
Russian S-300 air defence launches from Makiivka, Donetsk Oblast.
Russian S-300 air defence launches from Makiivka, Donetsk Oblast.
No explosions reported. Interceptions presumably took place beyond the city.
Ukrainian UAVs struck the Tuapse Oil Terminal in Krasnodar Krai. One impact was recorded to Oil Terminal Pier 1 (44.083356, 39.070962), where a fire is now burning and growing.
Ukrainian UAVs struck the Tuapse Oil Terminal in Krasnodar Krai. One impact was recorded to Oil Terminal Pier 1 (44.083356, 39.070962), where a fire is now burning and growing.

Multiple Ukrainian UAVs have impacted the 220 kV electrical substation in Alchevsk, Luhansk Oblast. The substation's transformer seems to be the target, as a large fire is now burning there.
Coordinates: 48.45193, 38.85056

Multiple Ukrainian UAVs have impacted the 220 kV electrical substation in Alchevsk, Luhansk Oblast. The substation's transformer seems to be the target, as a large fire is now burning there.
Coordinates: 48.45193, 38.85056

Russia, Ukraine Exchange Strikes With Hundreds Of Drones (Videos)
Russia and Ukraine exchanged drone strikes over the night of October 31 and November 1, with the first launching more than double the number of drones used by the latter.
The Ukrainian Air Force said in a statement that a total of 223 suicide drones were launched by the Russian military. German-type drones were the majority. As usual, the air force alleged that most of the drones were intercepted, in this case it was 206 of the drones.
Despite these claims, blasts were reported in the regions of Kiev, Cherkasy, Poltava, Sumy, Chernihiv, Kharkiv, Donetsk, Dnipropetrovsk, Mykolaiv, and Odessa.
Read more 
HERE

The Price Of Desperation: Ukraine‚Äôs Suicide Rearguard At Pokrovsk
Pokrovsk is where Ukraine‚Äôs reserve shortage became policy. As the front buckled in October 2025, Kiev rushed the 35th Separate Marine Brigade to extract the shattered 25th Air Assault Brigade‚Äîand flew in special-operations troops from Ukraine‚Äôs military intelligence by UH-60 Black Hawk to cover rotations in the industrial zone of the city. One aim: hold a corridor, pull forces out, buy hours.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Ukraine On November 1, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On November 1, 2025 (Maps Update)

Russian Army Advances In Vovchansk, Milove And Kupyansk In Kharkiv (Videos)
On November 1, the Russian military advanced in three areas in the Khrakiv direction, including near the key city of Kupyansk.
In Vovchansk, the Sever [North] Group of Forces has been advancing at a steady pace. Russian troops secured the entire southwestern part of the large settlement, and managed to cut the roading to Bilyi Kolodyaz after reaching the southern entrance.
Meanwhile, the Zapad [West] Group of Forces continues to expand its control in Kupyansk amid a collapse in Ukrainian defenses.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Northern Palestine On November 1, 2025 (Map Update)

Russian Troops Are All Over Pokrovsk (Videos)
On November 1, the Russian military expanded its control in Pokrovsk and nearby areas in Donetsk as Ukraine made more desperate attempts to hold onto the key city.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces took complete control of Rih to the east of Pokrovsk and a part of the trench south of the Kohozhkine suburb. Russian troops also secured southeastern Pokrovsk after capturing the trenches between Hnativka and Novopavlivka.
In the city center, the troops seized the motor depot and began assaulting new areas of the 8th district, right to the north of the railroad.
Read more 
HERE

Armenia Eyes Russian Su-30 Fighter Jets From India
Armenia is close to a multibillion-dollar deal with India to purchase Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)-built Su-30MKI fighter jets, Indian Defense News¬†reported on October 28.
If concluded, the deal, estimated at between $2.5 and $3 billion, would mark the largest defense procurement in the history of Armenia.
Citing sources within the defense industry, Indian Defense News said that the first batch, consisting of 8 to 12 aircraft, is expected to be delivered by the end of 2027.
Read more 
HERE

Pokrovsk Defenses Collapse: Ukraine‚Äôs Desperate Attempts To Hold Onto The City Are Failing¬†
An attempt to land GUR special forces near Pokrovsk was unsuccessful. Meanwhile, the Russian command has announced a breakthrough in defensive positions to the northeast of Petropavlovka in the Kupyansk sector. The personnel crisis in the Ukrainian Armed Forces is becoming a political problem for the country's leadership.
